awd_titl_txt: Methodological Training in Remote Sensing for the Study of  Management
awd_abstract_narration: This project is a training grant which allows an ecological                     anthropologist at Indiana university to study remote sensing and                Geographic Information Systems (GIS) to advance his ongoing study               of the tropical forest environment in Brazil.  The investigator                 will learn the use of specialized computer programs for analyzing               various types of environmental and social data in a geographic                  context.  After the training period the investigator will                       continue his analysis of the causes of deforestation in the                     Amazon Basin.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Social, Behavioral and Economic Sciences
org_div_long_name: Division of Behavioral and Cognitive Sciences
